briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Risedronate in the Treatment of Osteogenesis Imperfecta in Children

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* OI diagnosis
* increased risk of fracture: either has a history of at least 1 radiographically confirmed, non-traumatic or low impact fracture plus low bone mineral density (BMD) or has very low BMD with or without a history of fractures.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Any bisphosphonate use within one year of enrollment

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA)and read by central reader.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA)and read by central reader.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body BMD at Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent Change from baseline in Total Body Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by DXA.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body BMD at Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent Change from baseline in Total Body Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by DXA.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body BMD at Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent Change from baseline in Total Body Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by DXA.

Lumbar Spine Z-score - Percent Change From Baseline to Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Lumbar Spine Z-score - number of standard deviations a patient's BMD differs from the average BMD of their age, sex, and ethnicity. Positive scores indicate BMD above the mean; Positive values are "best values" and negative values are "worst values".

outcomeMeasures.title: Lumbar Spine Z-score - Percent Change From Baseline to Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Lumbar Spine Z-score - number of standard deviations a patient's BMD differs from the average BMD of their age, sex, and ethnicity. Positive scores indicate BMD above the mean; Positive values are "best values" and negative values are "worst values".

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Lumbar Spine Bone Mineral Density (BMD) measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA)and read by central reader. Duplicate scans obtained at screening and Month 12.

outcomeMeasures.title: Lumbar Spine Z-score - Percent Change From Baseline to Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Lumbar Spine Z-score - number of standard deviations a patient's BMD differs from the average BMD of their age, sex, and ethnicity. Positive scores indicate BMD above the mean; Positive values are "best values" and negative values are "worst values".

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Body Z-score- Percent Change From Baseline to Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Total Body Z-score - number of standard deviations a patient's BMD differs from the average BMD of their age, sex, and ethnicity. Positive scores indicate BMD above the mean; Positive values are "best values" and negative values are "worst values".

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Body Z-score- Percent Change From Baseline to Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Total Body Z-score - number of standard deviations a patient's BMD differs from the average BMD of their age, sex, and ethnicity. Positive scores indicate BMD above the mean; Positive values are "best values" and negative values are "worst values".

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Body Z-score- Percent Change From Baseline to Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Total Body Z-score - number of standard deviations a patient's BMD differs from the average BMD of their age, sex, and ethnicity. Positive scores indicate BMD above the mean; Positive values are "best values" and negative values are "worst values".

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Area at Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured by DXA.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Area at Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured by DXA.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Area at Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured by DXA.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body Bone Area Month 12, ITT Population
Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body Bone Area Month 24, ITT Population
Percent Change From Baseline in Total Body Bone Area Month 36, ITT Population
New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture at Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Morphometric Vertebral Fracture measured by semi-quantitative (SQ) analysis of x-rays using the Genant scoring system at endpoint. (Ref: Genant 1993). SQ-Scores range from 0 (no fracture) to 3 (severe fracture). New fracture = SQ score is 0 at baseline and \>0 at the specified end visit.

outcomeMeasures.title: New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture at Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Morphometric Vertebral Fracture measured by SQ analysis of x-rays using the Genant scoring system. (Ref: Genant 1993). SQ-Scores range from 0 (no fracture) to 3 (severe fracture). New fracture = SQ score is 0 at baseline and \>0 at the specified end visit.

outcomeMeasures.title: Categorization by Number of New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture at Month 12, ITT
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients with 1 or more New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture as measured by SQ analysis of x-rays using the Genant scoring system (Ref: Genant 1993). SQ-Scores range from 0 (no fracture) to 3 (severe fracture). Incidence = SQ score is 0 at baseline and \>0 at post-baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Categorization by Number of New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture at Month 36, ITT
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients with 1 or more New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture as measured by SQ analysis of x-rays using the Genant scoring system (Ref: Genant 1993). SQ-Scores range from 0 (no fracture) to 3 (severe fracture). Incidence = SQ score is 0 at baseline and \>0 at post-baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence New Vertebral Fractures by SQ (Semi-Quantitative) Score, Patients Aged 4-9 Years, Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients aged 4-9 years with new morphometric vertebral fractures as measured by SQ analysis of x-rays using the Genant scoring system at Month 12 +/- 14 days. (Ref: Genant 1993). SQ Score mild - 0/no fracture to Grade 1, Moderate to Severe - change from 0/no fracture to Grade 2-3.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence New Vertebral Fractures by SQ Score, Patients Aged 10-15 Years, Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients aged 10-15 years with new morphometric vertebral fractures as measured by SQ analysis of x-rays using the Genant scoring system at Month 12 +/- 14 days. (Ref: Genant 1993). SQ Score mild - 0/no fracture to Grade 1, Moderate to Severe - change from 0/no fracture to Grade 2-3.

outcomeMeasures.title: Probability of Fracture in 12 Months (Kaplan-Meier Cumulative Incidence), ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Long bones include radius, ulna, humerus, tibia, fibula, femur, upper limb and lower limb fracture.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Clinical Fractures, Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Long bones include radius, ulna, humerus, tibia, fibula, femur, upper limb and lower limb fracture.

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum BAP - Percent Change From Baseline to Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Serum Bone Alkaline Phosphatase (BAP - bone formation marker). Negative percent changes indicate response to treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum BAP - Percent Change From Baseline to Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Serum Bone Alkaline Phosphatase (BAP - bone formation marker). Negative percent changes indicate response to treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Serum BAP - Percent Change From Baseline to Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Serum Bone Alkaline Phosphatase (BAP - bone formation marker). Negative percent changes indicate response to treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Urine NTX/Cr - Percent Change From Baseline at Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Urine type-I collagen N-telopeptide/creatinine (NTX/Cr; bone resorption marker). Negative percent changes indicate response to treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Urine NTX/Cr - Percent Change From Baseline at Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Urine type-I collagen N-telopeptide/creatinine (NTX/Cr; bone resorption marker). Negative percent changes indicate response to treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Urine NTX/Cr - Percent Change From Baseline at Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Urine type-I collagen N-telopeptide/creatinine (NTX/Cr; bone resorption marker). Negative percent changes indicate response to treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Wong-Baker FACES Pain Rating Scale - Change From Baseline to Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Wong-Baker FACES Pain Rating Scale (pain assessment scale using facial expressions, translated into a range from 0= no pain \[smiling face\] to 10= worst pain possible \[distorted face with tears\]; negative values indicate decrease in pain). Reference: Wong DL et al.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bone Age (Years), Change From Baseline to Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Bone Age determined by visual assessment of hand / wrist radiographs.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bone Age (Years), Change From Baseline to Month 24, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Bone Age determined by visual assessment of hand / wrist radiographs.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bone Age (Years), Change From Baseline to Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Bone Age determined by visual assessment of hand / wrist radiographs.

outcomeMeasures.title: Annualized Growth Velocity - Change From Baseline to Month 12, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Annualized Growth Velocity \[= bone age change from baseline x (365.25/time in days between baseline and the bone age measurement)\]

outcomeMeasures.title: Annualized Growth Velocity - Change From Baseline to Month 36, ITT Population
outcomeMeasures.description: Annualized Growth Velocity \[= bone age change from baseline x (365.25/time in days between baseline and the bone age measurement)\]
